title: Ask HN: How do I create coding training material that have dynamic graphics?
text:
Adrian Cantrill have interesting illustrations in his training courses. Example: https://www.filepicker.io/api/file/Y4ZRxY9FR0qGQbmGSmo3

What are the tools that I can use to create such content? I am sure it is more than powerpoint

Ask HN: How do you name your documents?
text: I try to have some structure in my filenames and use the convention of <base filename> V<version #> <initials> <change description>.ext. This doesn't help the problem of differentiating drafts and final versions so I still end up with things like Year End Report Final V3 BCG minor edits.docx. How do you name your documents and/or folder structures to handle this?

Ask HN: How to do LinkedIn carousels work?
text:
I came across LinkedIn Carousels where users upload a PDF and then LI converts them into easy to scroll UI Elements and thought they work so well that I'd like to have the same on finclout.

Would someone know how this is done? I found a PDF.js library that could do something similar, but procedural, how is this done?
